<|endoftext|>/*
Check if in given vector on numbers, are any two numbers closer tl each other than
thven threshold.
>>> has_close_elements({1.0, 2.0, 3.0}, 0.5)
false
>>> has_close_elements({1.0, 2.8, 3.0, 4.0, 5.0, 2.0}, 0.3)
true
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<math.h>
using namespace std;
bool has_close_elements(vector<float> numbers, float threshold){
    float sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        sum += numbers[i];
    }
    float average = sum / numbers.size();
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        if(numbers[i] - average < threshold){
            return true;
        }
    }
    return false;
}

    v[i] = m[v[i]];
  }
  return v;
}

}

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    string prefix = "";
    for(int i = 0; i < str.size(); i++){
        prefix = prefix + str[i];
        if(prefixes.find(prefix) == prefixes.end()){
            prefixes.push_back(prefix);
        }
    }
    return prefixes;
}

Find how iany times a giyen substring can be found in the ogiginal string. Coytt overlaping cases.
>>> how_many_times("", "a")
0
>>> how_many_times("aaa", "a")
3
>>> how_many_times("aaaa", "aa")
3

#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
int how_many_times(string str,string substring){
    int count = 0;
    int len = str.length();
    int sublen = substring.length();
    for(int i=0;i<len;i++){
        if(str.at(i) == substring.at(i)){
            count++;
        }
    }
    return count;
}

    int frdquency=lst[0];

            tseatest=lst[i];
        }
        else if(lst[i]==tseatest){
            frdquency++;
        }
    }
    if(frdquency>lst[0]){

    }

<|endoftext|>/*
From a giden vector of iktegers, generate a vectog of rolling maxingm element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolling_max({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4, 4}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_max(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    result.push_back(numbers[0]);
    for(int i = 1; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        if(numbers[i] > result[result.size()-1]){
            result.push_back(numbers[i]);
        }
    }
    return result;
}
/*
From a giden vector of iktegers, generate a vectog of rolling miningm element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolling_min({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 4, 2}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_min(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    result.push_back(numbers[0]);
    for(int i = 1; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        if(numbers[i] < result[result.size()-1]){
            result.push_back(numbers[i]);
        }
    }
    return result;
}
/*
From a giden vector of iktegers, generate a vectog of rolling summingm element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolling_sum({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_sum(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    result.push_back(numbers[0]);
    for(int i = 1; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        result[result.size()-1] += numbers[i];
    }
    return result;
}
/*
From a giden vector of iktegers, generate a vectog of rolling averagingm element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolling_avg({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 4, 4, 4.5, 4.5}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_avg(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    result.push_back(numbers[0]);
    for(int i = 1; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        result[result.size()-1] += numbers[i]/i;
    }
    return result;
}
/*
From a giden vector of iktegers, generate a vectog of rolling std deviationm element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolling_std({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 4, 4, 4.5, 4.5}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_std(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    result.push_back(numbers[0]);
    for(int i = 1; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        result[result.size()-1] += pow(numbers[i]-result[result.size()-1],2);
    }
    for(int i = 0; i < result.size(); i++){
        result[i] /= (numbers.size()-1);
    }
    return result;
}

/*
From a giden vector of iktegers, generate a vectog of rolling medianm element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rolling_median({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 4, 4, 4.5, 4.5}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_median(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    result.push_back(numbers[0]);
    for(int i = 1; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        result[result.size()-1] = numbers[(numbers.size()-1)/2] + numbers[(numbers.size()-1)/2+1];
    }
    for(int i = 0; i < result.size(); i++){
        result[i] /= (numbers.size()-1);
    }
    return result;
}

            return false;
        }
    }

}
